intro: Octarrhena angustissima, commonly known as the narrowleaf octarrhena, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound leaves that are typically narrow and finely divided. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
